newsitem.title: ROMANIA: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.
newsitem.headline: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.

text.p: * The Romanian ambassador to the United States, Mircea Geoana, has been heard by a U.S. Senate defence commission on the Balkan country's bid to for early NATO membership.

Commission members hailed Romania's "huge democratic progresses" in the past few months and said "the U.S. must nominate Romania among countries to join NATO in a first wave of admission", Geoana told the state radio.
* The government discusses new banking laws, including a bill on the organisation of the central bank and one on the status of the savings bank Casa de Economii si Consemnatiuni.
The cabinet will also discuss a bill on foreign investment and a government decree to set up a special tax for road maintenance and repairs.
* Central bank governor Mugur Isarescu is expected to present the new banking legislation during a press briefing later this afternoon.
* The president of United States's Procter & Gamble, John Pepper, met President Emil Constantinescu on Wednesday.
Pepper told Constantinescu that his company had chosen Romania as its headquarters for central and Eastern European operations due to its domestic stability and skilled labour.
* Foreign Minister Adrian Severin wil visit the Vienna headquarters of the Organisation for Security and Cooperation (OSCE) in Europe.
* Severin will also travel to Yugoslavia on Friday to meet his counterpart Milan Milutinovic and will go to Zagreb on Monday to meet his Croatian counterpart Mate Granic.
* Trade union federation CNSLR Fratia said it will start month-long protests against price increases and delays in issuing reform legislation and social protection measures.
